newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Oct 29.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Oct 29.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde.
-- European countries to set up measures allowing them to retaliate against possible trade sanctions imposed by the United States on firms dealing with Cuba, Lybia or Iran.

-- Thomson Multimedia consumer electronics group owned by Thomson SA set to break even in second half of 1996 after a first-half loss, chairman Alain Prestat says in an interview. A planned state recapitalisation will reduce indebtedness, and licence fee income is expected to earn one billion francs a year from 1998, he adds.
-- Computer services firms Sligos and Axime consider industrial alliance.
